text: Does anyone have a role on their team for a content marketer that works specifically in video? We're looking to grow video on our team in 2022 but don't currently have the in-house skills to manage video creation and thinking about someone who can both strategize the what/why of videos AND create them. Does anyone have a role like this and have recommendations on how to make it successful/job descriptions they can share?

text:
I used to work with some very talented video editors and producers.

My gut is that you can't expect one person to be both a content marketer and a talented producer/editor. I mean, maaaaaybe you'll find someone like that, but the best combos I've seen is where Business Concept people work with Creative Masterminds.

The business people are the content marketer types: they figure out the positioning, distribution, and the strategic why of the video's content. Then they brief in the video maker(s).

Video is massive in and of itself. You've got pre-production (planning, storyboarding, location scouting, talent wrangling), then production (shooting A-roll, B-roll) then post (file mgmt, editing)

The rare gems out there can be one person and rock most of pre-thru-post.

To ask them also to be a content marketer, understand business stuff, handle distro questions, etc... you're pushing it IMO.

If you've only room for one video-related person on the team, I say invest in a rock solid editor. A good editor can take a mess of A-roll, find stock B-roll, and cobble together a compelling narrative from a project that had little planning.

text: Thanks <@U01AHL8AGBB>! A follow-up question I guess is I see two sides of the "Business Concept" portion - there's part A which is understanding how to turn video into something that helps our bottom line and leads to sales (an art not a science of course) and then part B which is understands our industry and can know what content topics to focus on, what stories to tell, etc. I'm more concerned with someone who can do Part B and figure out the content material and then can make it happen - do you still thank that person is a unicorn?
